column1: noa is Quenya word. J.R.R. Tolkien reversed its meaning over the years: (1) one manuscript has "ekuva nin kare sa noa"
column2: translated as "I may do that tomorrow"
column3: where noa is "tomorrow"; (2) another manuscript gives noa yesterday
column4: from the expression noa rÄ“ ("former day").

column1: Helge Fauskanger has suggested that the form noa
column2: analyzed "basically an adjective" (with the meaning "former" or "yesterday") could be valid Neo-Quenya.Helge Fauskanger
column3: "http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/eng-quen.rtf English-Quenya Wordlist (Quettaparma Quenyanna)" at http://folk.uib.no/hnohf/ Ardalambion (accessed 25 June 2011)
